comments: Numbers n such that (n+1) does not divide C(3n,n)-C(2n,n) - _Benoit Cloitre_, May 23 2004
references: L. Lindroos, A. Sills and H. Wang, Odd fibbinary numbers and the golden ration, Fib. Q., 52 (2014), 61-65.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: F:= combinat[fibonacci]:b:= proc(n) local j;      if n=0 then 0    else for j from 2 while F(j+1)<=n do od;         b(n-F(j))+2^(j-2)      fi    end:a:= n-> 4*b(n)+1:seq(a(n), n=0..70);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, May 15 2016
prog: (Python)for n in range(1, 700, 2):    if n*2 & n == 0:        print str(n)+',',
author: _Marc LeBrun_
extensions: More terms from _Benoit Cloitre_, May 23 2004 and _Alonso del Arte_, Jun 18 2012
